Text.Page:
My father was a woodcutter, but he also had a soft spot for nature. After logging, he always planted more seedlings than the number of trees he cut down, telling me we should return what we owe to nature.

He emphasized that it's important to understand and harmonize with the faeries who also treasure nature and the forest. At least until...that...happened."What? What happened?"

My father was a good friend of the faeries in the nearby forest. Among them, the closest one to my father was a centaur called {@LinkCreature:2#203#Likhan}.

When I got to know him through my father, I thought that centaurs were wise and generous creatures.

But one day, my father went missing after he'd gone to meet Likhan. He was later found dead with lance and hoof wounds. It was terrible."I'm so sorry."

Oh father...we'll be together in the Dream someday.

Please rest in peace now. Thank you, .
